programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty welcome their long-time rival Fred Nolan to the dig and make an exciting discovery.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Aggressive, greedy and one-eyed gators all bring big problems for the hunters, and one swamper takes a big risk by daring to go out alone.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: On his first night on the Coq, prairie tow operator Jonny Tipton faces his toughest recovery, while Gord Boyd clashes with stubborn truckers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff examine items signed by President Franklin D Roosevelt, as well as a rare photograph taken during baseball star Babe Ruth's debut season.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams track down an MGB GT and a Mazda MX-5, as they are challenged to find and strip small and sporty cars. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty make an extraordinary discovery in the island's surrounding waters.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of mystery creatures in the world's lakes and lochs, and whether living descendants of the dinosaurs could exist underwater.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts question what probes on Mars may have found over the past 40 years, asking if Nasa could be hiding proof of life on the Red Planet from the public.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick has a big decision to make when a programme from the unveiling of the Statue of Liberty shows up. He also hits the road to check out a 1966 Chevy II.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed AC/DC album and a Beals Model Remington revolver give the team pause for thought. Plus, Rick searches for new ways to publicise the pawn shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry asks a member of rock band Aerosmith for a valuation, and Dave discovers an antique toy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les shocks the others when he reveals his plans to buy a new store. Meanwhile, a man wanting to pawn his VCR causes a scene, and another tries to get money for his fake eye.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams track down an MGB GT and a Mazda MX-5, as they are challenged to find and strip small and sporty cars. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team examines a declassified US Department of Defence report which analyses an alleged encounter between a fighter pilot and a UFO in May 1980

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine evidence that aliens may have visited Mecca's Grand Mosque and Jerusalem's Temple Mount.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty make an extraordinary discovery in the island's surrounding waters.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an upscale area of Toronto for another auction, while Roy is on the lookout for high-end items, but needs to be able to scupper Rick and Cindy's plans.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: There are power struggles as the Kenny family battle to bag a big deal, while Roy is letting all the ladies steal the lockers from his clutches.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Apollo 11 mission to the moon and the suggestion that the moon is actually a giant spacecraft allowing extraterrestrials to monitor Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia spans over six million square miles of some of the most rugged terrain on Earth, much of which is uninhabited and largely unexplored. It is also the home of cosmism - a belief that human civilization originated in the cosmos.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for an extended edition of the topical quiz from December 2017, with Labour MP Angela Rayner and comedian Joe Wilkinson joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Greg Davies, presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle and journalist Janet Street-Porter to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include people who use suitcases on wheels, multichannel TV, umbrellas, friends' hobbies and women who like to be treated as ladies.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features Jo Brand, Joan Rivers, Aisling Bea, Kerry Godliman, Nina Conti, Luisa Omielan, Gina Yashere, Angela Barnes, Zoe Lyons, Holly Walsh, Desiree Burch and Tanyalee Davis.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian's quest to sample four distinctly glamourless professions continues as he faces his toughest crowd yet - seven children for whom he becomes mother for a day.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles build an outdoor 'man-cave' space suitable for watching American football, complete with comfortable sofas.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Kevin and Andrew Buckles decide to build a retreat from the retreat, in the form of an igloo on the lake with all of the amenities of a luxury hotel.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Springfield, Massachusetts, where Indian Motorcycles was founded and chase a legend that could be a real buried treasure.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarado brothers stumble across an interesting collectible, while Brandon and Lori bid on a storage facility for pets.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and the Alvarado brothers get devious, while a frustrated Brandon and Lori look as if they might end up leaving the auction empty-handed.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get their fill of petroliana at a pick in Vermont, and Frank and Dave head to Florida in search of a super-rare cycle car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event in Peru, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Seattle, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenter Gabby Logan and comedian Andy Hamilton, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes Dr Christian Jessen and EastEnder Diane Parish. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings on the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford, chart star Paloma Faith and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Deborah Meaden compete to have their pet hates banished on the panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include people who use the phrase 'all due respect', smart-casual dress, jobsworths, people in lifts and Fifty Shades of Grey.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges his five fearful funny people to entertain him by completing more baffling challenges, which this week involve corneas, crackers and construction.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mathematician Rachel Riley, singer JB Gill, newscaster Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Singer Cilla Black, Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis and The Great British Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc compete to have their pet hates banished by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include dream bores, giant charity cheques, Las Vegas, knickers and people who make others sign cards.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Writer-presenter Clive Anderson, The One Show host Alex Jones and actor-comedian Jack Whitehall compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include British-themed bars in foreign countries, shared tables, deer, seagulls and metrosexuality.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Dara O Briain, Nina Conti and Danny Bhoy
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy show has Dara O Briain warming up the crowd before introducing routines by ventriloquist extraordinaire Nina Conti and the irrepressible Danny Bhoy.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is back on home turf - cooking for comedian Phil Wang, who is performing his Philly Philly Wang Wang show in London's West End..

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Phil Wang makes sure his outstanding outfit leaves even less to the imagination than it did before and Jessica Knappett demonstrates her mastery of a child's percussion instrument.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Inbetweeners star Greg Davies, veteran stand-up Jo Caulfield and one-liner specialist Gary Delaney join host Dara O Briain and panellists Chris Addison, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons for another round of the satirical current affairs panel show. From September 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended version of a 2007 edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, presented by Kirsty Young. Former Labour politician Bob Marshall-Andrews and Dr Phil Hammond join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie and Tyler are united in their distaste when Marlene demands that the family pays a visit to her mother in Bournemouth. Elgin, Jed, and Mrs Cakeworthy take desperate measures when Bryan begins to mope as the anniversary of his fourth engagement to Myrtle draws ever closer. Guest starring June Whitfield.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Waterloo Dead
programme.desc: Two hundred years after the Battle of Waterloo, investigators Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson employ forensic techniques to uncover surprising secrets from one of the greatest military encounters of all time.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: John Christie: Serial Killer - Part One
programme.desc: The first of two programmes looking at the case of John Christie, who murdered at least eight women, including his own wife.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at children's Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the house's gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Stoke-on-Trent to Winsford, Cheshire, finding out about one of the greatest locomotive factories in railway history along the way. He also discovers the dark side of the Industrial Revolution and learns how Victorian potteries brought their products to the masses.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Dudley in the West Midlands to Bridgnorth, Shropshire. He learns how Victorian blacksmithing was not for the faint-hearted, rides on one of Britain's most modern trains and traverses the Victoria Bridge at Bewdley in Worcestershire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bowood House in Wiltshire. Among the items being brought in for valuation are a collection of glass ornaments, an 18th-century portrait that children have used for target practice, a carved walking stick, a book documenting the travels of a 19th-century explorer and an account of the sinking of the Titanic by an officer who survived.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. On the first leg, he helps feed the crew of Britain's newest battleship, discovers how the Victorians planned to repel a possible French invasion and learns there is a well-established industry in an unlikely location.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: A marine biologist and a deep-sea diver explore Chuuk Lagoon, one of the world's greatest underwater graveyards, for a wreck discovered by sonar nearly 20 years ago.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie faces his worst nightmare when Marlene's sister decides to pay a visit from Peckham. As if the man-eating glamourpuss was not enough to cope with, he finds all his staff tied up in the barn - and realises his past has come back to haunt him. Guest starring Paula Wilcox.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A visit to a local country mansion reveals Boycie's admiration for the long-established tradition of respect for the gentry. Elgin moves into Bryan's caravan after being thrown out by his wife, leading to relentless gossiping by Mrs Cakeworthy. When the mobile home burns down Marlene offers the two men a place to stay, much to her husband's chagrin. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie and Tyler are united in their distaste when Marlene demands that the family pays a visit to her mother in Bournemouth. Elgin, Jed, and Mrs Cakeworthy take desperate measures when Bryan begins to mope as the anniversary of his fourth engagement to Myrtle draws ever closer. Guest starring June Whitfield.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch face a tough challenge when a fire breaks out in an indoor market. Meanwhile, Carol takes romance a step further.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The soldiers help to rescue hostages in the African state of Mokindi. Meanwhile, Sadie and Paul are reunited. Starring Robson Green and Duncan Bell.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers find themselves stuck in Kenya's Makindi province, struggling to find a safe pick up point. Meanwhile, Dave and Donna are unsure about their future together.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A potential rival prompts Jac to go in for the kill with Joseph, and Kyla becomes convinced Abra is not being completely truthful with her. Meanwhile, Mark clashes with Connie over a patient, but a surprise outcome awaits him. Medical drama, starring Robert Powell and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Holby A&E is thrown into chaos by a sudden influx of patients, leaving Charlie and Directorate Manager Dan Robinson struggling to find enough beds to accommodate them. To make matters worse, people also start to arrive suffering from a mystery illness - and all have previously visited the hospital over the past few weeks. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Grant Masters.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is on the trail of a secret obsession. Pat's efficiency surprises Frank. Alan arrives on the scene just in time to help Bianca out of a tricky situation.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Robbie goes off the rails in The Square, while Sharon believes Grant and Dougie are up to no good.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch rescue a man trapped in an industrial chimney trying to rescue a cat, and avert tragedy when a caravan collapses.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack has to deal with a patient whose employer will not let her rest. Meanwhile, Isabel and Ken's romance takes a dive when their ward collapses at the Battle of Britain fly-past. Drama starring Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally has time to reflect on recent events, with Megan staying at Luke's and Billy preoccupied with work, but she is soon kept busy when she spots suspicious bruises on the son of a former school friend. Danny reluctantly goes on a date with old flame Teresa, but is left confused when Kim provides the romance, and Joe tells Alice he wants to take things slowly as he finally shows signs of maturity.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: While reseaching her book on prisons, Dorien meets an incarcerated Chris on a visit to the Isle of Wight, and is promptly taken in by his criticisms of Sharon as a bad wife. Comedy, starring Lesley Joseph, Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere neglects to invite Audrey to the annual Hunt Ball - so she plans a socially acceptable revenge. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour sets about proving that skiing does not have to be an expensive sport. However, with snow in short supply he determines that he, Compo and Clegg need to use dinner trays. Long-running rural comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Day of the Welsh Ferret
programme.desc: Compo has an interesting experience when he loses his ferret as the trio make their way to a friend's funeral.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Ellen Mallam is left to drown in an upturned car by its driver, but the young woman's connection to James Blackstone, an aristocratic family's heir apparent, impedes Gently and Bacchus's investigation. The chief inspector discovers that the son's future has been carefully mapped out since birth by his implacable mother Alethea, and she will not countenance any interference in her plans. However, an astonishing twist causes the detectives to reconsider the case in its entirety. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Geraldine Somerville, James Norton, Roger Lloyd Pack, Christopher Fairbank and Ebony Buckle.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo and Harry's professional rivalry erupts following Sam's departure. They deal with the case of several children who experienced unexplained breathing difficulties, leaving one of them dead. While Harry believes this was mass hysteria, Leo suspects something more sinister. Meanwhile, a man is found dead in his car with a stab wound to the chest. Tom Ward and William Gaminara star.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants' precision skills are put to the test with a complex butchery, filleting or shellfish prep round, before preparing a rack of lamb in 10 minutes. After the first round, three of the contenders are sent home, with the final three cooks tasked to create the ultimate lamb dish to impress guest judge, Phil Vickery.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team from the highway maintenance office calling themselves the Hard Shoulders answer top 10 list questions on subjects including Formula One, pizza toppings and music. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Lucy, Chris, Cameron and Jessica pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain and Aaron are trying to adjust to life in lockdown and Cain is adamant he won't be opening up about his feelings. When a letter arrives with a prison stamp on it, Cain, not wanting Aaron to slip back into his hole of despair over Robert, hides the letter in a magazine.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally is swayed by Yasmeen's change of heart when she enters a not guilty plea, while back on the street, Geoff is furious and tells Tim they need to show a united front. Gary tracks down Laura to the address in Rochdale and promises to ensure Rick keeps paying her living expenses if she'll take Kelly back under her wing.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: A special series looking back at Bradley and Barney's previous American adventures. The first episode sees the pair start in Los Angeles. Kicking things off in Venice beach, the pair get in shape with a game of volleyball and pump some weights at Muscle Beach, but the following the day Bradley is pushed to his limits when Barney reveals he has arranged for them to go skydiving. Leaving Los Angeles behind them, they head into the desert towards Arizona as they venture onto the famous Route 66, where the pair head off to Cowboy College.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Sheron and Billy Dawson check in for some pool-side fun, bringing along their teenage son Rob, young daughter Jodie, and Grandad Eddie, to claim the sun-loungers left vacant following the Garveys' departure from the vacation spot. Meanwhile, resort boss Joyce Temple-Savage is desperate for new staff, and must choose between efficient, goody two-shoes Amber and the outrageously flirtatious Marcus, and Troy returns to Benidorm with Jacqueline and Kenneth to scatter Donald's ashes in the place he loved best. Julie Graham, Steve Edge and Bobby Knutt join the cast of the comedy drama set in the sun-kissed Solana resort.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five cinema workers from East Anglia, known collectively as the Popcorn Sweepers, answer questions based on top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round on subjects that include film, pop music, sport and food and drink. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they use ancient techniques and modern technology to produce thousands of tonnes of barbecue charcoal? How do they cook up Japan's soba noodles?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam find themselves down in the south west of England rummaging around another belting shed. There are so many things on offer they find it hard to choose.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Cornwall, Henry and Sam find some very rare early-1900s steam-powered cars. Henry might even be lucky enough to have a go in one.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: One of the boats suffers a total blackout while navigating a stretch of water riddled with icebergs. Meanwhile Elliott gets a rude awakening, and a rookie fisherman learns an important lesson.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New mining team The Tunnel Rats blasts its way to a fortune and solo prospector Col Duff gets stranded deep in the Queensland outback. Rookie Sam runs out of air underground.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, a team struggles to pull apart a retired yacht. In Lewisham, south London, a tower block is demolished, while in Lancashire a tractor reveals treasure.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 1966 Morris Minor Traveller for the bargain price of £2,400, and makes plans for Edd China to renovate it so he sell it on for at least £7,000

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells four cars at auction in Kissimmee, Florida, but fears they will become lost in a crowd of 2,000 lots.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells two cars at Mecum Auctions and cannot resist bidding for vintage jeeps and a Chevy pickup.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The team tries out a range of new tests, new races and new motors from around the world. As well as meeting motoring legends, stars put top supercars through their paces.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New mining team The Tunnel Rats blasts its way to a fortune and solo prospector Col Duff gets stranded deep in the Queensland outback. Rookie Sam runs out of air underground.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the Northwestern fights to stop its boat from capsizing, and more ice forces the Time Bandit crew members off their fishing grounds.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 19th-century Bradford weaving mill, where he discovers industrial trolleys and containers. In Cheshire, he visits a manor house mentioned in the Domesday book.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The work of demolition, salvage and waste management experts as they blast, crush and smash their way through a variety of structures which have had their day. In Ironbridge, Shropshire, four massive towers from an old coal station are blown up. Plus, in Wakefield a mother and daughter watch as their house is demolished.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is pleased to buy a V8-engined BMW 840 coupe - but when mechanic Edd China sees the condition it is in, he struggles to muster the same enthusiasm.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Old partners Aaron Grotjahn and Col Duff reunite on a prospecting mission. Meanwhile, the Tunnel Rats race to protect their claim as rival miners close in.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a fledgling antiques business run by an enterprising young couple in London. Plus, he faces punishing negotiations at a living history museum in Surrey.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle an antique child's rocking chair, a vintage cash register, and a miniature Peter Pan gramophone that is no longer able to play records.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how marble is produced, the building of escape slides and how mah-jong pieces are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A case centred on a woman, whose body was found in the boot of a car. Forensic clues led detectives to the killer of a 19-year-old youth.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Andrew Nesbitt, found dead on his 46th birthday in his Wisconsin apartment after a night out. Officers sought clues from CCTV in local bars, cabs and street corners.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: How the double homicide of a young mother and her baby daughter sent Galax's tiny police force on a frenzied mission to stop unspeakable evil in its tracks.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The agents face a difficult challenge in the form of a band of political extremists that has pulled off two major bank robberies with precision.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Max Mixson puts his life at risk during an armed siege when he tries to rescue more than 100 dogs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Victoria, where he trims the tusks of 220kg pig, tries to keep a three-legged cow on its feet and treats a dizzy dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Sibling rivalry gets in the way of a dress selection, and a soon-to-be-married woman disagrees with her brother over gown styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Sasha is looking for a pink dress to honour her mother's battle with breast cancer, while Penny receives some tough love from her family to help her stand tall.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Holly wants to look like a princess, but her mother and grandma have other ideas, while Lauren has yet to lay eyes on her custom-made ballgown.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors hunt for items that they can upcycle at an antiques market in Nice on the French Riviera, before heading back to sell them at an auction in Bournemouth.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwicks Pawnbrokers in London, boss Nathan and his right-hand woman Debbs do deals on high-fashion footwear and 22-tonne mega-trucks. At London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, owner Dan and manageress Ellie take in a multi-diamond deal from local businesswoman 'Botox Sue' and a rare fighter jet helmet - and deliver a shock when they value some family heirlooms.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The team closes down a cat shelter to save the lives of the surviving occupants after finding some already dead.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Derek Schlitter seeks justice for a puppy he finds left for dead in a backyard.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How tiny shreds of evidence can be crucial in proving the guilt or innocence of suspects, focusing on the murders committed by David Middleton and the killings of Bunchee Nyhuis and Jeffrey Russell.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Exploring the mind of an obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the often confused workings of the criminal psyche.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Leah Roberts who vanished in March 2000 after leaving North Carolina to do some soul-searching on a cross-country trip. The Jeep in which she was travelling was found damaged and abandoned a week later 3,000 miles from her home, close to the Canadian border, with some of her personal possessions scattered around it.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: When 79-year-old Vern Holbrook failed to show up to meet his daughter-in-law, his family feared the worst. Police chased several leads only to discover a shocking, vengeful murder plot.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Samantha wants a dress that shows off her tattoo, but her mother is not impressed. Meanwhile, singer Vanessa needs a 1930s-style dress for her jazz-inspired wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kristi is marrying a pro-baseball pitcher and needs a glamorous dress, while sports fan Jenna wants a gown that will impress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant girl Ashley wants a completely new look, although her family is not keen on the idea, while rodeo queen Becky wants to stand out.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Anastagia wants to choose her own dress, but first she needs to battle her mother's influence. Lisa clashes with her mum over an ivory gown.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: Everything Your Parents Told You Was a Lie
programme.desc: Kris suspects her adoptive parents withheld vital information about her birth, while Ben wants to know why he was adopted, but not his sister.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pauline must find the will to keep up her weight-loss progress after a medical emergency. Plus, Chay's journey has changed course in dramatic way.

programme.title: My Extreme Excess Skin
programme.desc: People considering surgery to remove excess skin following extreme weight loss.

programme.title: How to Look Good Naked
programme.desc: Stylist Gok Wan helps friends Ames and Helen rebuild their confidence and learn to love their post-baby bodies. Will they be ready to bare all on the catwalk?.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents investigating the death of a New York petrol station mogul infiltrate the crime ring responsible and discover a Mafia world of brutality and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Tyre marks and fibres snare a murderer who stabbed two women, and a man stages an 'accident' to kill his wife.
